Class GUIInputGameAdapter

java.lang.Object
lista4.adapters.GUIInputGameAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameInputAdapter<String>
public class GUIInputGameAdapter extends Object implements GameInputAdapter<String>
An implementation of GameInputAdapter tailored for GUI clients.

This class acts as a bridge between the raw string commands received from a GUI client and the internal logic of the GameManager. Its main responsibilities are:

  • Validating the format of incoming move commands using Regex.
  • Translating string coordinates (e.g., "A 1") into integer grid coordinates (x=0, y=0).
  • Delegating valid moves to the GameManager.

  • Method Details

    • setOutAdapter

      public void setOutAdapter(GameOutputAdapter outAdapter)
      Updates the output adapter used by the GameManager.

      This method ensures that the game logic sends responses to the correct output channel (the GUI output adapter in this context).

      Specified by:
      setOutAdapter in interface GameInputAdapter<String>
      Parameters:
      outAdapter - The new GameOutputAdapter to be used by the game.

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(String input, PlayerColor color) throws WrongMoveFormat
      Processes a move command received from the GUI.

      The method expects a string in the format "[Letter] [Number]" (e.g., "C 5"). It converts the letter to an X-coordinate (A=0, B=1...) and the number to a Y-coordinate (1=0, 2=1...).

      Specified by:
      makeMove in interface GameInputAdapter<String>
      Parameters:
      input - The raw command string from the client.
      color - The color of the player attempting the move.
      Throws:
      WrongMoveFormat - If the input string does not match the expected coordinate format.

    • sendBoard

      public void sendBoard(PlayerColor color)
      Requests the game manager to broadcast the current board state.
      Specified by:
      sendBoard in interface GameInputAdapter<String>
      Parameters:
      color - The player requesting the board update (or responsible for the trigger).
